p: The predicted data suggest that global average temperature could increase by 4.8 °C by the end of 2100, and current policies (without PACC) were not good enough to deal with this global environmental issue [ 9]. Based on the facts, global leaders and stakeholders of global sustainability strongly believe that the PACC will help to reduce global greenhouse gas emissions and its adverse global impact. The threshold level is 2 °C ( Figure 1); however, policy makers want to ensure that the global average temperature rise by 2100 will not exceed 1.5 °C by intensifying global efforts.
